title: Reduce LP loss by half (round it down) for the remaining players if there is an AFK (RIOT PLS LOOK)
body:
But:

1. Make AFK punishments a bit harsher (so that duo queuers or "sanctimonious" players can't abuse it).
2. Don't change any LP gains for any winners (can be arguable because the team with less players can theoretically win, and some people think they deserve an extra reward).
3. Give tilt-proof players (from the honoring) a little extra reward (a little more chests, keys, etc.), if they have been honored as tilt-proof in the game with the AFK, even if they win. 

Although people in the boards are mostly complaining about damage creep and stat checking, fixing this "AFK then lose" issue with the above ideas can allow players to feel a bit less stressed about their potential loss, because they will have a little more access to the bright side of their situation. But idk if Riot would approve or even care to look at this post, so what do you guys think?

replies.body: You'd have to also halve LP gains to avoid inflating the average rank. And non-leavers wouldn't benefit from that change in the long term.

> [{quoted}](name=DearPear,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=6xOV3foK,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2018-12-26T04:08:20.451+0000)
>
> You'd have to also halve LP gains to avoid inflating the average rank. And non-leavers wouldn't benefit from that change in the long term.

It would still make sense to do this. You qued up to face a full 5 on 5 match. If you're handed a free win then it's no longer a fair system overall. 

Think of it this way, if you were on the winning side of a 5 v 4 as part of the 5, is it bearable that you gained a little less LP because of the AFK on their team? 

Otherwise the reverse side is you're losing a full amount of LP for a loss if you're in the same game but on the losing side that really nothing can be done about unless there is a ridiculous skill difference between the two sides. 

Which one feels worse to you? 

I wouldn't mind gaining 15 free LP for a free win instead of 20, and having the enemy lose 15 instead of 20 because they basically handed it over. It just means games that have AFK's have less weight compared to a fair full 5 v 5. Which in my opinion makes sense as a measure of skill.

It's not so much about how it occasionally feels, it's about how the system would react as a whole. You don't plan on fucking up a whole system to fix a minor issue. 

This is a mathematical situation, AFKs **will** earn you more LP than they make you lose, period. Any change on LP loss must be exactly mirrored on LP gains so the system isn't totally fucked, meaning that most non-leaving players would benefit more from the current situation than the "fixed" situation.

Thats why I left in the bottom paragraph that you would mirror the amount of LP lost by the losing team in terms of gains. So if this game would have normally netted you 20 LP it would only net you 15 instead because the enemy team had an afk. And if you were on the losing side of the same game you wouldn't lose 20 LP but rather 15 LP because your team (Thats not partied with you) costed you the game. This way there is no inflation of the system because you're balancing off the amount lost by the amount gained, the only difference is, is that you're minimizing the effect of a game that doesn't accurately measure your own skill due to an outside factor, which is what ranked is all about in the first place. 


Edit: If anything it would cause a small amount of deflation each time because if you are duo'd with someone you would still lose 20 LP and therefore 2 people would actually end up losing more LP than was gained by the other team. So you wouldn't have a problem with inflated LP, but rather the other way around.

the problem is the ends wont justify the means. this would increase toxicity to get someone to AFK once it looks like a loss. this would also increase the amount of people running it down because trolls would run it down to maximize teammates losses.
and the duos who would do this would do so on throwaway accounts they dont give 2 shits about.

Riot can always make it ban-able to try to force someone to AFK, that can help reduce that potential toxicity. And usually the AFKers aren't really trolls, they probably DC'd (should've specified that, but it's a more common occurrence than a troll from my experience), and like Arctic Husky said they can just make this unavailable to duo queues.

And usually the AFKers aren't really trolls, they probably DC'd (should've specified that, but it's a more common occurrence than a troll from my experience), and like Arctic Husky said they can just make this unavailable to duo queues.

It's already bannable to AFK, and yet people still do it. Riot cannot ever make people _benefit_ from someone else's bannable behavior, because that would encourage such behavior.

1. I am aware that going AFK is punishable, I suggested that FORCING someone to go AFK (toxic player flames someone to go AFK) should be bannable if said changes were to be implemented,

2. I also understand that such encouragement would arise from the benefit, hence why I offered that there be harsher punishment.

Harassing other players to go AFK is bannable in itself, and going AFK also opens yourself up to punishments. 

You could also incentivise it so that the person that does go afk actually loses more LP than they normally would which would make them think twice about actually doing it.   

The number of people running it down mid won't change because the circumstances of whether or not that individual account is punished and how badly it is doesn't change whether or not someone went AFK. It's two separate issues. Intentional trolling is for all intents of purposes makes no difference or not whether people on their team save a bit of LP or not. Why? Because as the system is right now, you can achieve the same goal (You can still run it down mid and ruin the game for people, so this change doesn't affect that). That means the only real difference is the games where someone is not trolling but rage quits, or D/Cs for whatever reason then those people in the game will benefit from the LP mitigation. 

If this change went through it would only be done to protect the randoms in games. The people that are qued together should lose the same amount of LP as they would if they normally lost the game. This would prevent abuse as it would be as though they  lost the game normally anyways.

I don't really understand what you're saying with this last part sorry.

Edit, it would only apply to the game thats at hand. It doesn't matter or not if your friend left the last game and then you duo'd with him after. How it works is if you duo with someone and they leave THAT specific game then you will still lose the full LP for that game because you were qued with the leaver. Not because they left the game before. I hope this is what you were referring to.

This system will save more bystanders by reducing the amount of LP they lost. How much can be debated but even saving 5lp from a game that was basically an auto lose because of an AFK feels better than losing the full amount.

What about the people with internet that goes out every once in a while?
What about the people that have a real life emergency pop up out of nowhere and absolutely have to leave?
Should those people get a harsher punishment for no reason?

I know that this may sound a bit assuming and blunt, but get better internet if you have that issue. And for those with emergencies, I'm pretty sure the person in question will be more worried about what's going on irl, rather than a punishment in a video game. Plus, emergencies don't tend to happen that oftenly, and the slightly harsher punishment doesn't necessarily have to occur after your first AFK.
